answers.answer: Hi there. You have metastatic breast disease with secondaries in bone. The cervical spine disc herniations are apparently responsible for the dizziness, numbness of left hand. Lumbar spine MRI needs to be done to exclude any lumbar nerve root irritation. Peripheral neuropathy causes like diabetes, autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis, vitamin deficiencies  need to be checked. Another possibility for these varied symptoms could be a paraneoplastic syndrome due to the breast cancer. Discuss these possibilities with your neurologist when you meet him. Take care.

question: Hi I am a 50 year old woman who has metastatic Disease. Breast to bone, quite a few spots. was having some issues with my left side. eye site problems, dizzy, memory lose short term but quite often. my left ear is not hearing right and sick to my stomach, numb left fingers and toes. My Dr. had a MRI done of my neck and a ct on my spine . Appears that there is some disc deterioration at c4-5 with spondiylosis disease at c4 to c6,at c6 and 7 I have a  protruson the ventral aspect of the cervical cord.  My Doctor could not explain him self out of a paper bag so now Im going to see what I come up with!!   Thanks so much,  Francesnoee
title: what is Bifrontal cortical atrophy?
